          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1452137#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1452137#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 11:05 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Thanks a lot for this report! This is really unfortunate, I think we shouldn't process events like installing code inside of loops. So long-term, I think we should distinguish between side-effectful interrupts and other interrupts and only handle some of them in loop stack checks. But this is way too complicated for a security fix, so I guess we have to accept the possible regressions and just change the side effects of `JSStackCheck`. I'll prepare a CL.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks a lot for this report! This is really unfortunate, I think we shouldn't process events like installing code inside of loops. So long-term, I think we should distinguish between side-effectful interrupts and other interrupts and only handle some of them in loop stack checks. But this is way too complicated for a security fix, so I guess we have to accept the possible regressions and just change the side effects of `JSStackCheck`. I'll prepare a CL.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1452137#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by

        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jun 14, 2023, 4:41 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        Thanks. Yes I think changing the side effect of `JSStackCheck` is probably the safest thing to do for now, especially when there is no guarantee what may get added to the list of tasks that are handled via interrupts. (The handling of code installation is probably added after concurrent inlining was enabled)<span class="line"><!---->Thanks. Yes I think changing the side effect of `JSStackCheck` is probably the safest thing to do for now, especially when there is no guarantee what may get added to the list of tasks that are handled via interrupts. (The handling of code installation is probably added after concurrent inlining was enabled)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

        The fix in <span class="line"><!---->The fix in <!----></span>comment #11<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c11"><!---->comment #11<!----></a> (<span class="line"><!----> (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/4610750<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/4610750"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/4610750<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> is sufficient and safe to backmerge from a stability/security point of view, but causes quite some performance regression. The fixes mentioned in comments #22 and #24 are both individually enough to fix the issue, but target different parts of the system. It is probably enough to back-merge one of them if we want to avoid the performance regression of #11.<span class="line"><!----> is sufficient and safe to backmerge from a stability/security point of view, but causes quite some performance regression. The fixes mentioned in comments #22 and #24 are both individually enough to fix the issue, but target different parts of the system. It is probably enough to back-merge one of them if we want to avoid the performance regression of #11.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi Amy<span class="line"><!---->Hi Amy<!----></span><br><br>in V8 we had already decided that for security reasons Tobias' fix is better. Unfortunately we lose some perf, but Maglev is also being rolled out in M114 which will more than compensate for the loss. We'll recover peak perf soon enough anyway. Let's please merge back the fix in #11.<span class="line"><!---->in V8 we had already decided that for security reasons Tobias' fix is better. Unfortunately we lose some perf, but Maglev is also being rolled out in M114 which will more than compensate for the loss. We'll recover peak perf soon enough anyway. Let's please merge back the fix in #11.<!----></span><br><br>My fix is a good step towards fixing it in a perf-neutral way going forward, but to make it safe we need to add CHECKs that could break Chrome if they are overzealous, so they aren't backmergable.<span class="line"><!---->My fix is a good step towards fixing it in a perf-neutral way going forward, but to make it safe we need to add CHECKs that could break Chrome if they are overzealous, so they aren't backmergable.<!----></span><br><br>Thanks,<span class="line"><!---->Thanks,<!----></span><br>Toon<span class="line"><!---->Toon<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        <mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog id="update-issue-hotlists"></mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog>

      <div class="snackbar-container" aria-live="polite">

 }

 a.src=g;m.parentNode.insertBefore(a,m)
 })(window,document,'script','https://storage.googleapis.com/chops-feedback/feedback.js','crdx');
 crdx('setFeedbackButtonLink', 'https://bugs.chromium.org/p/monorail/issues/entry?template=Online%20Feedback');
});
</script>

<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {

    background: none;

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;

    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);

  }

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

            Issue 1452137: Security: Type confusion in v8 caused by incorrect side effect modelling of JSStackCheck
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1452137: Security: Type confusion in v8 caused by incorrect side effect modelling of JSStackCheck
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      m-y...@github.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/404590096" title="m-y...@github.com"><!---->m-y...@github.com<!----></a>
      m-y...@github.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->m-y...@github.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Wed, Jun 7, 2023, 10:58 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jun 7, 2023, 10:58 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jun 7, 2023, 10:58 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1452137: Security: Type confusion in v8 caused by incorrect side effect modelling of JSStackCheck
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jun 7, 2023, 10:58 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1452137: Security: Type confusion in v8 caused by incorrect side effect modelling of JSStackCheck
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jun 7, 2023, 10:58 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      </div>
      
        
          
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        Description #1 by m-y...@github.com (Jun 7, 2023)

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by m-y...@github.com (Jun 7, 2023)

      </div>
      Vulnerability details<span class="line"><!---->Vulnerability details<!----></span><br><br>The `JSStackCheck` operator is marked with the `kNoWrite` property [1], which is used for operators that does not have side effects. This operator, however, can call into the `Runtime::kStackGuard` function [2], which can handle interrupts from other threads [3]. As can be seen from the definition of `HandleInterrupts` [4], it can call many different functions, some of which may have side effect [4]. In particular, the `INSTALL_CODE` [5] interrupt will install optimized JIT code, which can install the `PrototypePropertyDependency` and call `EnsureHasInitialMap` [6]. `EnsureHasInitialMap` takes the function argument, and check if the `initial_map` field is already set, if not, then it will call `SetInitialMap`, which sets the `prototype` object of the function to the prototype of a map [7]. This then calls `OptimizeAsPrototype` [8], which can change the map of the prototype object. Combining this side effect with `CheckMaps` elimination in the `LoadElimination` optimization phase, a `JSStackCheck` can be used to change the map of an object after a `CheckMaps` is performed. Since `JSStackCheck` is inserted at the end of every loop iteration [9], this can be done by inserting a loop between a `CheckMaps` and a subsequent property access of an object whose map is checked before the loop (the `CheckMaps` after the loop is eliminated if the loop does not have any side effect other than the ones that come from `JSStackCheck`). By changing the object's map in `JSStackCheck` after the `CheckMaps` is passed, a type confusion occurs.<span class="line"><!---->The `JSStackCheck` operator is marked with the `kNoWrite` property [1], which is used for operators that does not have side effects. This operator, however, can call into the `Runtime::kStackGuard` function [2], which can handle interrupts from other threads [3]. As can be seen from the definition of `HandleInterrupts` [4], it can call many different functions, some of which may have side effect [4]. In particular, the `INSTALL_CODE` [5] interrupt will install optimized JIT code, which can install the `PrototypePropertyDependency` and call `EnsureHasInitialMap` [6]. `EnsureHasInitialMap` takes the function argument, and check if the `initial_map` field is already set, if not, then it will call `SetInitialMap`, which sets the `prototype` object of the function to the prototype of a map [7]. This then calls `OptimizeAsPrototype` [8], which can change the map of the prototype object. Combining this side effect with `CheckMaps` elimination in the `LoadElimination` optimization phase, a `JSStackCheck` can be used to change the map of an object after a `CheckMaps` is performed. Since `JSStackCheck` is inserted at the end of every loop iteration [9], this can be done by inserting a loop between a `CheckMaps` and a subsequent property access of an object whose map is checked before the loop (the `CheckMaps` after the loop is eliminated if the loop does not have any side effect other than the ones that come from `JSStackCheck`). By changing the object's map in `JSStackCheck` after the `CheckMaps` is passed, a type confusion occurs.<!----></span><br><br>Thank you very much for your help and please let me know if there is anything I can help.<span class="line"><!---->Thank you very much for your help and please let me know if there is anything I can help.<!----></span><br><br>Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<span class="line"><!---->Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<!----></span><br><br>1. <span class="line"><!---->1. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ba1b4d2b303094d63f500878f3670f2235f988c7:v8/src/compiler/js-operator.cc;l=1406<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ba1b4d2b303094d63f500878f3670f2235f988c7:v8/src/compiler/js-operator.cc;l=1406"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ba1b4d2b303094d63f500878f3670f2235f988c7:v8/src/compiler/js-operator.cc;l=1406<!----></a><br>2. <span class="line"><!---->2. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ba1b4d2b303094d63f500878f3670f2235f988c7:v8/src/compiler/js-generic-lowering.cc;l=1197<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ba1b4d2b303094d63f500878f3670f2235f988c7:v8/src/compiler/js-generic-lowering.cc;l=1197"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/ba1b4d2b303094d63f500878f3670f2235f988c7:v8/src/compiler/js-generic-lowering.cc;l=1197<!----></a><br>3. <span class="line"><!---->3. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/10e4809ce95862289c62ea30a18ab32bb77ea5c8:v8/src/runtime/runtime-internal.cc;l=349<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/10e4809ce95862289c62ea30a18ab32bb77ea5c8:v8/src/runtime/runtime-internal.cc;l=349"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/10e4809ce95862289c62ea30a18ab32bb77ea5c8:v8/src/runtime/runtime-internal.cc;l=349<!----></a><br>4. <span class="line"><!---->4. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/10e4809ce95862289c62ea30a18ab32bb77ea5c8:v8/src/execution/stack-guard.cc;l=267<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/10e4809ce95862289c62ea30a18ab32bb77ea5c8:v8/src/execution/stack-guard.cc;l=267"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/10e4809ce95862289c62ea30a18ab32bb77ea5c8:v8/src/execution/stack-guard.cc;l=267<!----></a><br>5. <span class="line"><!---->5. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/10e4809ce95862289c62ea30a18ab32bb77ea5c8:v8/src/execution/stack-guard.cc;l=324<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/10e4809ce95862289c62ea30a18ab32bb77ea5c8:v8/src/execution/stack-guard.cc;l=324"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/10e4809ce95862289c62ea30a18ab32bb77ea5c8:v8/src/execution/stack-guard.cc;l=324<!----></a><br>6. <span class="line"><!---->6. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/10e4809ce95862289c62ea30a18ab32bb77ea5c8:v8/src/compiler/compilation-dependencies.cc;l=247<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/10e4809ce95862289c62ea30a18ab32bb77ea5c8:v8/src/compiler/compilation-dependencies.cc;l=247"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/10e4809ce95862289c62ea30a18ab32bb77ea5c8:v8/src/compiler/compilation-dependencies.cc;l=247<!----></a><br>7. <span class="line"><!---->7. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/0cd12c35f217ed6982b34fcb29dc15d14a6e57eb:v8/src/objects/js-function.cc;l=762<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/0cd12c35f217ed6982b34fcb29dc15d14a6e57eb:v8/src/objects/js-function.cc;l=762"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/0cd12c35f217ed6982b34fcb29dc15d14a6e57eb:v8/src/objects/js-function.cc;l=762<!----></a><br>8. <span class="line"><!---->8. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/0cd12c35f217ed6982b34fcb29dc15d14a6e57eb:v8/src/objects/map.cc;l=2308<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/0cd12c35f217ed6982b34fcb29dc15d14a6e57eb:v8/src/objects/map.cc;l=2308"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/0cd12c35f217ed6982b34fcb29dc15d14a6e57eb:v8/src/objects/map.cc;l=2308<!----></a><br>9. <span class="line"><!---->9. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/0cd12c35f217ed6982b34fcb29dc15d14a6e57eb:v8/src/compiler/bytecode-graph-builder.cc;l=3547<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/0cd12c35f217ed6982b34fcb29dc15d14a6e57eb:v8/src/compiler/bytecode-graph-builder.cc;l=3547"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/0cd12c35f217ed6982b34fcb29dc15d14a6e57eb:v8/src/compiler/bytecode-graph-builder.cc;l=3547<!----></a><br><br>Reproduction case<span class="line"><!---->Reproduction case<!----></span><br><br>To reproduce the issue, run the attached `stackcheck.js` with `d8`:<span class="line"><!---->To reproduce the issue, run the attached `stackcheck.js` with `d8`:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>./d8 --allow-natives-syntax stackcheck.js<span class="line"><!---->./d8 --allow-natives-syntax stackcheck.js<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>The `allow-natives-syntax` is used for printing out debug information and to make JIT compilation more predictable, it does not affect the vulnerability itself.<span class="line"><!---->The `allow-natives-syntax` is used for printing out debug information and to make JIT compilation more predictable, it does not affect the vulnerability itself.<!----></span><br><br>This uses the type confusion to change an object from fast map to dictionary map, and then use the subsequent property write to overwrite the length of the dictionary, allowing access to out-of-bounds objects. This can be seen from the debug print output of the object. Subsequent access to the properties causes a crash.<span class="line"><!---->This uses the type confusion to change an object from fast map to dictionary map, and then use the subsequent property write to overwrite the length of the dictionary, allowing access to out-of-bounds objects. This can be seen from the debug print output of the object. Subsequent access to the properties causes a crash.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome version: d8 main branch commit a7e2bef and version 11.4.183.19 (which is used in the latest release of Chrome)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: d8 main branch commit a7e2bef and version 11.4.183.19 (which is used in the latest release of Chrome)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Man Yue Mo of GitHub Security Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1452137#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by

          Comment 9<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1452137#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      m-y...@github.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/404590096" title="m-y...@github.com"><!---->m-y...@github.com<!----></a>
      m-y...@github.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->m-y...@github.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 9:29 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 9:29 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1452137#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 9:29 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1452137#c9">Comment 9<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 9:29 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Please find attached an exploit that runs shellcode using this vulnerability. It is tested on commit 56e5481 (version 11.4.183.19) and a7e2bef on Linux Ubuntu (22.04) and does not require the `--allow-natives-syntax` flag. It should succeed often, but can fail due to the randomness involved in the layout of dictionary objects. A failure does not result a crash and can be detected in the script. In case of running on Chrome, when a failure is detected, the page can simply be reloaded to retry the exploit. For standalone d8, just rerun the exploit. To test, run the attached script on d8:<span class="line"><!---->Please find attached an exploit that runs shellcode using this vulnerability. It is tested on commit 56e5481 (version 11.4.183.19) and a7e2bef on Linux Ubuntu (22.04) and does not require the `--allow-natives-syntax` flag. It should succeed often, but can fail due to the randomness involved in the layout of dictionary objects. A failure does not result a crash and can be detected in the script. In case of running on Chrome, when a failure is detected, the page can simply be reloaded to retry the exploit. For standalone d8, just rerun the exploit. To test, run the attached script on d8:<!----></span><br><br>./d8 exploit.js<span class="line"><!---->./d8 exploit.js<!----></span><br>If succeeded, it should pop a shell and give the following output:<span class="line"><!---->If succeeded, it should pop a shell and give the following output:<!----></span><br>func address: 19ba61<span class="line"><!---->func address: 19ba61<!----></span><br>jit code address: c56cd640 55ef<span class="line"><!---->jit code address: c56cd640 55ef<!----></span><br>$ <span class="line"><!---->$ <!----></span><br>In case of failure, it should print out the following:<span class="line"><!---->In case of failure, it should print out the following:<!----></span><br>func address: 7ff80000<span class="line"><!---->func address: 7ff80000<!----></span><br>jit code address: 9999999a 40019999<span class="line"><!---->jit code address: 9999999a 40019999<!----></span><br>exploit failed, please retry<span class="line"><!---->exploit failed, please retry<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
            
      
        
          
          exploit.js<b><!---->exploit.js<!----></b>
          
        <div class="filename">
          
          <b><!---->exploit.js<!----></b>
          
        </div>
        
          
            2.8 KB<div class="filesize"><!---->2.8 KB<!----></div>
            
              View<a class="attachment-view" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/attachmentText?aid=601287">View</a>
            
            Download<a class="attachment-download" target="_blank" href="attachment?aid=601287&amp;signed_aid=JPycP4Z6Ilq8QSBr8hkyYw==">Download</a>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>

      tebbi@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->tebbi@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1452137#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 11:05 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1452137#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jun 13, 2023, 11:05 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Thanks a lot for this report! This is really unfortunate, I think we shouldn't process events like installing code inside of loops. So long-term, I think we should distinguish between side-effectful interrupts and other interrupts and only handle some of them in loop stack checks. But this is way too complicated for a security fix, so I guess we have to accept the possible regressions and just change the side effects of `JSStackCheck`. I'll prepare a CL.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks a lot for this report! This is really unfortunate, I think we shouldn't process events like installing code inside of loops. So long-term, I think we should distinguish between side-effectful interrupts and other interrupts and only handle some of them in loop stack checks. But this is way too complicated for a security fix, so I guess we have to accept the possible regressions and just change the side effects of `JSStackCheck`. I'll prepare a CL.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks. Yes I think changing the side effect of `JSStackCheck` is probably the safest thing to do for now, especially when there is no guarantee what may get added to the list of tasks that are handled via interrupts. (The handling of code installation is probably added after concurrent inlining was enabled)<span class="line"><!---->Thanks. Yes I think changing the side effect of `JSStackCheck` is probably the safest thing to do for now, especially when there is no guarantee what may get added to the list of tasks that are handled via interrupts. (The handling of code installation is probably added after concurrent inlining was enabled)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div class="issue-diff">

        This is sufficiently serious that it should be merged to stable. But I can't see a Chromium repo commit here, so you will need to investigate what - if anything - needs to be merged to M114. Is there a fix in some other repo which should be merged? Or, perhaps this ticket is a duplicate of some other ticket which has the real fix: please track that down and ensure it is merged appropriately.<span class="line"><!---->This is sufficiently serious that it should be merged to stable. But I can't see a Chromium repo commit here, so you will need to investigate what - if anything - needs to be merged to M114. Is there a fix in some other repo which should be merged? Or, perhaps this ticket is a duplicate of some other ticket which has the real fix: please track that down and ensure it is merged appropriately.<!----></span><br><br>This is sufficiently serious that it should be merged to beta.         The fix in <span class="line"><!---->The fix in <!----></span>comment #11<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c11"><!---->comment #11<!----></a> (<span class="line"><!----> (<!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/4610750<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/4610750"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/4610750<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> is sufficient and safe to backmerge from a stability/security point of view, but causes quite some performance regression. The fixes mentioned in comments #22 and #24 are both individually enough to fix the issue, but target different parts of the system. It is probably enough to back-merge one of them if we want to avoid the performance regression of #11.<span class="line"><!----> is sufficient and safe to backmerge from a stability/security point of view, but causes quite some performance regression.         Hi Amy<span class="line"><!---->Hi Amy<!----></span><br><br>in V8 we had already decided that for security reasons Tobias' fix is better. Unfortunately we lose some perf, but Maglev is also being rolled out in M114 which will more than compensate for the loss. We'll recover peak perf soon enough anyway. Let's please merge back the fix in #11.<span class="line"><!---->in V8 we had already decided that for security reasons Tobias' fix is better. Unfortunately we lose some perf, but Maglev is also being rolled out in M114 which will more than compensate for the loss. We'll recover peak perf soon enough anyway. Let's please merge back the fix in #11.<!----></span><br><br>My fix is a good step towards fixing it in a perf-neutral way going forward, but to make it safe we need to add CHECKs that could break Chrome if they are overzealous, so they aren't backmergable.<span class="line"><!---->My fix is a good step towards fixing it in a perf-neutral way going forward, but to make it safe we need to add CHECKs that could break Chrome if they are overzealous, so they aren't backmergable.<!----></span><br><br>Thanks,<span class="line"><!---->Thanks,<!----></span><br>Toon<span class="line"><!---->Toon<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">

            </chops-button>
            
      
        <slot></slot>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
